summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of David Rogers, a pilot for Jeffrey Epstein since 1991. Rogers provides details about Epstein's flight operations, aircraft, staff, and travel patterns. He states he never witnessed underage females on the aircraft but acknowledges many females aged 21-23. The document includes a list of Epstein's current and past employees provided by Rogers.

persons.name: David Rogers
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI agents. Employed by Epstein since July 1991, was Chief Captain until January 2005 when demoted after a disagreement with Epstein over landing techniques.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Wealthy individual employing pilots and staff, owner of aircraft through subsidiary companies, frequent traveler on his own planes.

persons.name: Bruce M. Lyons
persons.context: Present during Rogers' FBI interview, from the law firm Lyons and Sanders.

persons.name: Larry Visoski
persons.context: Full-time pilot for Epstein, took over as Chief Pilot from David Rogers in January 2005.

persons.name: Gary Roxburgh
persons.context: Contracted pilot who assisted with flying Epstein to different locations in 2004 and 2005.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Former Personal Assistant to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Was Epstein's personal assistant until late 2001, when another individual (name redacted) took over primary duties.

connections.description: Rogers was employed as a pilot for Epstein from July 1991 until at least the interview date in 2006.
Lyons was present as Rogers' attorney during his FBI interview.
Both were pilots for Epstein; Visoski took over as Chief Pilot from Rogers in January 2005.
Maxwell was Epstein's personal assistant until late 2001.
Visoski is a full-time pilot for Epstein and became Chief Pilot in 2005.
Hammond is a full-time pilot for Epstein.
Morrison is a full-time flight engineer for Epstein.

events.title: David Rogers begins employment with Epstein
events.description: David Rogers started working as a pilot for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Rogers demoted, Visoski becomes Chief Pilot
events.description: David Rogers was demoted from Chief Captain after a disagreement with Epstein over landing techniques at Palm Beach International Airport. Larry Visoski took over as Chief Pilot.

events.title: Transition of personal assistant role
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's primary duties as Epstein's personal assistant were taken over by another individual (name redacted).

events.title: FBI interview of David Rogers
events.description: David Rogers was interviewed by FBI agents at the FBI Resident Agency's office, with his attorney Bruce M. Lyons present.

keyFacts: David Rogers, Epstein's pilot since 1991, stated he never witnessed any underage females aboard Epstein's aircraft but said there had been 'too many to count' females ranging in age from 21 to 23.

Rogers provided FBI agents with his 2004 and 2005 personal aircraft log book and passenger manifest forms for Epstein's Boeing 727 (tail N908JE) and Gulfstream (tail N909JE) via a Grand Jury Subpoena.
Epstein's aircraft were owned by subsidiary companies: JEGE, INCORPORATED (Boeing 727) and HYPERION AIR, INCORPORATED (Gulfstream), which Rogers believed was for liability reasons.
Rogers was demoted from Chief Captain in January 2005 after a disagreement with Epstein over landing techniques at Palm Beach International Airport, with Larry Visoski taking over.
The document contains a list of Epstein's current and past employees provided by Rogers, including property managers, house managers, assistants, a personal trainer, and chefs.
